unnormalised: UPI payments faced a slight hiccup this morning, with transactions failing at a rate higher than your average Monday morning blues. Sources say the issue stemmed from a "minor technical glitch" at NPCI, which, let's be honest, sounds like a polite way of saying someone tripped over the server. Some users trying to order their daily chai via PhonePe were greeted with error messages, while others attempting to buy that discounted saree on Myntra (Rs. 999 only!) found their payments stuck in limbo.
normalised: U-P-I payments faced a slight hiccup this morning, with transactions failing at a rate higher than your average Monday morning blues. Sources say the issue stemmed from a "minor technical glitch" at N-P-C-I, which, let's be honest, sounds like a polite way of saying someone tripped over the server. Some users trying to order their daily chai via PhonePe were greeted with error messages, while others attempting to buy that discounted saree on Myntra (rupees nine hundred and ninety nine only!) found their payments stuck in limbo.

unnormalised: "My payment of Rs. 250 to the sabziwala got stuck! He looked at me like I was trying to run away without paying," tweeted @DesiGamerDude, proving that even virtual wallets can't escape the wrath of an angry vegetable vendor. Reports also surfaced of issues with Paytm transactions, leaving many wondering if it's time to dust off those old Rs. 10 notes.
normalised: "My payment of rupees two hundred and fifty to the sabziwala got stuck! He looked at me like I was trying to run away without paying," tweeted at Desi Gamer Dude, proving that even virtual wallets can't escape the wrath of an angry vegetable vendor. Reports also surfaced of issues with Paytm transactions, leaving many wondering if it's time to dust off those old rupees ten notes.

unnormalised: The glitch, which lasted for approximately 2 hours, impacted various e-commerce platforms and online payment gateways. Experts suggest that this "minor hiccup" could result in a temporary dip in digital transaction volume, but let's be real, Indians will find a way to spend their money, even if it means bartering with neighbours.
normalised: The glitch, which lasted for approximately two hours, impacted various e-commerce platforms and online payment gateways. Experts suggest that this "minor hiccup" could result in a temporary dip in digital transaction volume, but let's be real, Indians will find a way to spend their money, even if it means bartering with neighbours.

unnormalised: NPCI released a statement assuring users that the issue has been resolved and that all pending transactions will be processed within 24 hrs. They also advised users to check their bank statements to confirm transaction status. So, if you're still waiting for that cashback of Rs. 50 from your last Amazon purchase, maybe give it a nudge.
normalised: N-P-C-I released a statement assuring users that the issue has been resolved and that all pending transactions will be processed within twenty four hours. They also advised users to check their bank statements to confirm transaction status. So, if you're still waiting for that cashback of rupees fifty from your last Amazon purchase, maybe give it a nudge.

unnormalised: In related news, rumors are circulating that the next government bailout package will be delivered entirely in Rs. 2000 notes, because why not add another layer of complexity to our already chaotic financial system? Stay tuned for more updates, and happy spending!
normalised: In related news, rumors are circulating that the next government bailout package will be delivered entirely in rupees two thousand notes, because why not add another layer of complexity to our already chaotic financial system? Stay tuned for more updates, and happy spending!
